intro: Triosteum perfoliatum, commonly known as the perforate speedwell, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive leaves with a central hole, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded areas along stream banks. Triosteum perfoliatum is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in its native range.
